statement:
Let $E$ be a Banach space. A convex subset $C$ of the dual space $E^*$
is closed in the weak-$*$ topology if and only if the intersection of
$C$ with the ball $B_{r}(0)$ is weak-$*$ closed for every $r>0$.

[1]{} Dunford, N., and J. T. Schwartz, *Linear Operators*, Part I,
Interscience Publishers, 1967.
